column4: Hello, I want to change DNS server address to Google Public DNS. Does anybody can help me to do that in Ubuntu? I found a guide here: https://developers.google.com/speed/public-dns/docs/using but I don't really understand the sudo vi /etc/resolv.conf part. Thank you.
Jpds, no, it opens in command line.
I'm sure there's a way to change DNS information without using the terminal, let me check
